actor_awards.notes: A dependable character actor best known for his roles in science fiction classics and as the playwright Lloyd Richards in 'All About Eve'. He also famously portrayed the detective Ellery Queen on both radio and television.

filmography.title: All About Eve
filmography.role_description: The successful playwright and husband of Karen Richards, who becomes a target of Eve Harrington's manipulation.
filmography.plot: A seemingly timid but secretly ruthless ingénue insinuates herself into the lives of an aging Broadway star and her circle of theater friends.

filmography.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
filmography.role_description: The jealous and ambitious boyfriend of Helen Benson who betrays the alien Klaatu to the military for fame.
filmography.plot: An alien lands on Earth and tells the people of the world that they must live peacefully or be destroyed as a danger to other planets.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Film Promoting International Understanding (Film)

filmography.title: Earth vs. the Flying Saucers
filmography.role_description: A scientist who races to develop a weapon to stop an alien invasion of flying saucers.
filmography.plot: Extraterrestrials in flying saucers attack Earth, and a scientist must find a way to stop them before they conquer the planet.
filmography.awards: Saturn Award: Nomination – Best DVD/Blu-Ray Collection (Film)

filmography.title: Twelve O'Clock High
filmography.role_description: A pilot perceived as a coward who is demoted and assigned to a plane named 'The Leper Colony' but eventually redeems himself.
filmography.plot: A hard-as-nails general takes over a bomber unit suffering from low morale and whips them into fighting shape.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Sound, Best Supporting Actor (Dean Jagger)

filmography.title: Elmer Gantry
filmography.role_description: A serious and devout reverend who clashes with the charismatic but opportunistic preacher Elmer Gantry.
filmography.plot: A fast-talking traveling salesman becomes a successful revivalist preacher in the 1920s American Midwest.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actor (Burt Lancaster), Best Supporting Actress (Shirley Jones)

filmography.title: Birdman of Alcatraz
filmography.role_description: The strict prison warden who opposes Robert Stroud's bird-keeping activities.
filmography.plot: A surly convicted murderer held in permanent isolation redeems himself when he becomes a renowned bird expert.

filmography.title: Seven Days in May
filmography.role_description: A TV commentator involved in the political intrigue surrounding a potential military coup.
filmography.plot: United States military leaders plot to overthrow the President because he supports a nuclear disarmament treaty and they fear a Soviet sneak attack.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor (Edmond O'Brien)

filmography.title: Meet Me in St. Louis
filmography.role_description: A suitor to the eldest Smith daughter, Rose, in this classic musical.
filmography.plot: In the year leading up to the 1904 St. Louis World's Fair, the four Smith daughters learn lessons of life and love.

filmography.title: Night and the City
filmography.role_description: A decent and loyal friend to the hustler protagonist, Harry Fabian.
filmography.plot: A small-time hustler in London dreams of becoming a wrestling promoter but gets in over his head with the local underworld.

filmography.title: Monkey Business
filmography.role_description: The stuffy and jealous ex-boyfriend of the protagonist's wife who tries to win her back.
filmography.plot: A chemist finds his personal and professional life turned upside down when one of his chimpanzees finds the fountain of youth.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actress (Ginger Rogers)

filmography.title: Rawhide
filmography.role_description: The ruthless leader of a gang of outlaws who take over a stagecoach station.
filmography.plot: An outlaw gang takes a stagecoach station hostage, intending to rob the next gold shipment.

filmography.title: World Without End
filmography.role_description: The commander of a spaceship that breaks the time barrier and lands on a post-apocalyptic future Earth.
filmography.plot: Astronauts returning from a voyage to Mars are caught in a time warp and crash on 26th Century Earth, populated by mutants and beautiful women.

filmography.title: Garden of Evil
filmography.role_description: The trapped husband whose rescue is the motivation for the dangerous journey.
filmography.plot: Three American soldiers of fortune are hired by a woman to rescue her husband trapped in a gold mine in Apache territory.

filmography.title: Come to the Stable
filmography.role_description: A songwriter and neighbor who is initially skeptical of the nuns' plan to build a hospital.
filmography.plot: Two French nuns arrive in a small New England town with a plan to build a hospital, despite having no money and facing local skepticism.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress (Celeste Holm, Ethel Barrymore)

filmography.title: Mrs. Parkington
filmography.role_description: A suitor to the Parkington daughter in this generational family drama.
filmography.plot: A lady's maid marries a wealthy man and rises in society, recounting her life story at age 84.

filmography.title: The Black Shield of Falworth
filmography.role_description: A nobleman who plays a key role in training the young protagonist for knighthood.
filmography.plot: A young peasant discovers his true heritage and trains to become a knight to reclaim his birthright.

filmography.title: Wait Till the Sun Shines, Nellie
filmography.role_description: A man whose relationship with the town barber's wife leads to tragedy.
filmography.plot: The life of a small-town barber, his family, and his town over 50 years.

filmography.title: Way of a Gaucho
filmography.role_description: A wealthy landowner and patron to the gaucho protagonist.
filmography.plot: In 1875 Argentina, a gaucho deserts the militia to lead a life of freedom, but civilization is encroaching.

filmography.title: Bugles in the Afternoon
filmography.role_description: A rival officer who creates conflict for the protagonist in this cavalry western.
filmography.plot: A former cavalry officer re-enlists as a private to clear his name and settles a score with an old enemy.

filmography.title: Illegal
filmography.role_description: A corrupt man involved in the criminal underworld, crossing paths with Edward G. Robinson's character.
filmography.plot: A District Attorney resigns in disgrace after sending an innocent man to the chair, then becomes a defense attorney for a crime boss.

filmography.title: Casanova's Big Night
filmography.role_description: A character in this Bob Hope comedy spoofing the legendary lover.
filmography.plot: A tailor's apprentice impersonates Casanova to test the fidelity of a Duchess.

filmography.title: Mr. Belvedere Rings the Bell
filmography.role_description: The reverend of a church-run home for the aged where Mr. Belvedere causes a stir.
filmography.plot: Mr. Belvedere embarks on a new adventure in a home for the aged, determined to make the residents feel young again.

filmography.title: Marriage Is a Private Affair
filmography.role_description: A supporting role in this Lana Turner wartime romantic drama.
filmography.plot: A young woman marries a pilot during WWII but struggles with the responsibilities of domestic life.

filmography.title: The Last Shot You Hear
filmography.role_description: A marriage counselor who refuses his wife a divorce, leading to a murder plot.
filmography.plot: A quiet marriage counselor's life takes a dark turn when his wife and his colleague plot to kill him.

filmography.title: Castle of Evil
filmography.role_description: One of the heirs gathered at a remote castle where a robot is programmed to kill.
filmography.plot: A disfigured scientist invites his heirs to his castle, where he plans to kill them with a laser-eyed robot.
